alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Kiowa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Comanche and southeastern Kiowa Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Mountain Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cooperton and northwestern Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
